Posts.Content: Oct 17, 2008 10:42AM boobytrapped wrote: Ailenroc - Path reports are only 60% accurate ??!!?  Yikes...where does that info come from ?  I just accepted my path report after lumpectomy w/o question, now I'm worried I was right to do that.  Learning soooo much from this site. Good luck to all going thru this hellaous journey.
Posts.Title: 2nd opinion: Pathology? EleanorJ misheley

Posts.Content: Nov 18, 2008 12:33PM boobytrapped wrote: What a great birthday present Brenda !  Glad radiation hasn't been too rough on you and congrats on being more than halfway done.  I'm like you, haven't planned ANYTHING for Christmas yet and yes, it will be a "gift certificate" holiday for sure.

Posts.Content: Nov 28, 2008 08:41AM boobytrapped wrote: Congrats Wendy and Traveler on being done!  I'm having my last tx later today and I'm so ready to move on from this.  I'm taking December off to heal and recoup and will then consider hormone therapy early January.  TGIF all and have a great weekend.  Karen
Posts.Title: November 2008 Rads Group HensonChi Ivy

Posts.Content: Nov 6, 2008 10:16AM boobytrapped wrote: Hi Sons, I'm doing the 3 week Canadian protocol, that's why our tx plans are so different. I guess ea dose is a bit stronger than traditional to make up for the shorter time span. I read alot about this shorter treatment and studies point to good outcome, so I requested this from my oncs.  They agreed I was a good candidate. Hope I won't start second-guessing my decision later. I figure all you can do, is learn as much as you can and make the decisions that work best for you.
Posts.Title: November 2008 Rads Group HensonChi Ivy

Posts.Content: Nov 10, 2008 07:40AM boobytrapped wrote: Oh Lenee, sorry to hear about your pleurisy and a trip to the ER. That sucks. Glad you're almost done tho.  I definitely envy you that part.  LOL  Also good to hear tx has been good to you, except for the pleurisy, of course. I'm  hoping we all have such good results and we'll be done soon.
Posts.Title: November 2008 Rads Group HensonChi Ivy

Posts.Content: Nov 17, 2008 08:06AM boobytrapped wrote: Morning ladies, hope everyone enjoyed their weekend off from rads.  I will be going for tx # 9 today.  Only 12 to go, I think. I'm doing the 3 week Canadian protocol and my rad onc is wondering whether I should do just the 16 sessions or do additional 5-6 boosts. How come he doesn't know this already ?   Grrrrr...I'd like to think I only have 8 more tx's but I really want to do the right thing and feel I've done everything I can to kill these little cancer suckers.  Anyone doing the 3 week protocol?  Are you doing boosts ? Happy Monday all. - Karen
Posts.Title: November 2008 Rads Group HensonChi Ivy

Posts.Content: Nov 6, 2008 08:39AM boobytrapped wrote: Hey all.  Had my 1st tx yesterday and it wasn't nearly as scary as I thought it might be - no giant death ray or anything.  LOL  Thought I was scheduled for 18 tx but found out it will actually be 21...  sigh. Oh well, guess I'm lucky its not the 33 or so that alot of you are having to do. I swear I'm becoming more of a scairdy (sp?) cat every day. I hear ya Sherrie about the emotional journey. I'll feel just fine and in control of my feelings and then I'll just suddenly burst into tears. And, I can't even decide what the hell I'm crying about. Just feeling sorry for myself maybe. I agree with you Suz about the soft clothes.  Time for the Victoria Secret stuff some time later, MUCH later maybe for me. So sorry so many of you have to drive so far. That must be tough. Hang in there all and we'll get through this.
Posts.Title: November 2008 Rads Group HensonChi Ivy

Posts.Content: Oct 28, 2008 02:30PM boobytrapped wrote: Hello ladies, Got my tats today and will be starting rads some time next week.  I didn't realize the tats involved a needle and that they're permanent !  Was a long appt and fairly uncomfortable inside the CT with your arms above your head and "DON'T MOVE" for about 40 min.  I will be doing 18 treatments which I think includes the boosts, not sure yet.  Hadn't seen my rad onc since 2 weeks ago when I had to have Contura balloon removed...bad fit for my cavity... so I've been doing a much needed "cancer vacation". No appts or anything for 2 whole weeks...yeah !  I've been buying creams too to get ready...99% aloe vera from Trader Joe and some kind of emu cream I found at Walgreens.  Bit nervous about another treatment but look forward to getting it done.  The journey that never ends.....
Posts.Title: November 2008 Rads Group HensonChi Ivy

Posts.Content: Nov 4, 2008 01:09PM boobytrapped wrote: Just got the call that I'll begin my 18 rads tomorrow.  I'm scheduled for all sessions at 3:30.  I think that works good for me...leave work early for tx and then go on home. Good luck with your catheter Susan. I was so hoping to do that tx but didn't work for me. I had the Contura inserted for about 5 days and then had it removed w/o a single treatment. Just wouldn't fit my cavity. Bummer. I also heard about the Sharpies ruining bras. I think I'll just wear my $5.99 sports bra for awhile.  Plus, all my other bras have an underwire and that's just been too uncomfortable. Good luck all! - Karen
Posts.Title: November 2008 Rads Group HensonChi Ivy

Posts.Content: Nov 26, 2008 10:08AM boobytrapped wrote: Happy Thanksgiving all.  I'm on tx #14 out of #16 - almost done !!!  My skin was doing great until Monday when the "sunburn" became really noticeable.  Ouch. I'll keep using my aloe and techs gave me some samples of Aquafor so maybe that will help.  I've been using Wellbutrin for the last 2 months cause I've been working on quitting smoking (almost 3 weeks quit!) but it hasn't helped my hot flashes at all. I get them all day and all night, sometimes 2-3 an  hour. Grrrrrr. Doc did mention another anti-depressant (probably the Effexor) that might help but for now I'm waiting. I'll see medical onc early January and I'll decide then about hormone therapy. Good luck to all.  Big that sux for all that have to travel so far for tx.
Posts.Title: November 2008 Rads Group HensonChi Ivy

Posts.Content: Oct 28, 2008 10:19PM boobytrapped wrote: Hey Sheltering....CANCER SUCKS !  My lumpectomy scar is in about the same area as yours - right where my underwire hits and I've been having hard time wearing a regular bra. If I do wear an underwire, I've been stuffing part of one of those soft surgical pads they sent home with me to help pad the wire area. Lump, SNB and balloon catheter incision sites are all still a bit sore and I'm also having that pulling feeling on underside of my arm which I guess is the SNB. Its gotten stiffer to move lately.  I think more stretching will help too. I've also found gently massaging my breast helps. I've got a hard knot of scar tissue at the lump site as well. Are y'all still having numbness around your lump scars?  I asked my rad onc about that today and he says for about 20-25% women that never entirely heals but for most it will heal in 4-7 months or so. YIKES. That sucks KAK - sorry to hear about your "slab-ectomy". Funny name for it, not so funny results.  Good luck.
Posts.Title: Just Wondering....After Lumpectomy shelteringtree KAK

Posts.Content: Nov 9, 2009 11:28AM boobytrapped wrote: Hello ladies, another stage 1 chiming in.  Haven't been on the boards for awhile and its nice to come back for a visit. Having my 1st one year mammo this week and I'm feeling really nervous. Getting that weird breathing anxiety thing going on. I know it will be fine and I'll feel much better after its over and done and behind me. Was using Arimidex for awhile but just hated it and stopped for now, but when I meet with my onc later this month, maybe I'll try it again. What a journey this bc crap takes us on huh? I had rads on left breast and it still feels so odd, dense and sorta numb, after almost a whole year. Does that ever go away entirely? Anyway, wishing good thoughts and gentle hugs to all who are still in treatment. Take care all.

Posts.Content: Nov 18, 2008 10:10PM boobytrapped wrote: I'm not sure I've exactly had a loss of apetite but I've definitely been feeling queasy every day. I believe its the anxiety during my rad tx mostly and just the overall anxiety of dealing with ALL of it. Ugh....I'll be glad when this part is over.  Unfortunately for me, I've still gained a few pounds that I definitely didn't need 'cause I've been doing the "poor me, have some chocolate" diet.
